newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan electricity demand seen up 2.1 pct in '97/98.
newsitem.headline: Japan electricity demand seen up 2.1 pct in '97/98.

text.p: Japan's electricity demand this fiscal year is expected to rise 2.1 percent from the previous year to 792 billion kilowatt hours (kWh), the Ministry of International Trade and Industry (MITI) said on Thursday.
The MITI figures are based on plans submitted to the ministry by Japan's 10 electricity utilities and three electricity wholesalers.
On the supply side, the 13 firms will have capacity to provide 185.08 million kilowatts in 1997/98, up 2.5 percent from a year earlier, MITI said.
